title: SEC Charges J.P. Morgan Affiliates
FINRA Fines J.P. Morgan $3M for Reporting Inaccuracies
Settlement of SEC Charges
JP Morgan Affiliates Pay to Resolve SEC Enforcement Actions
CFTC Orders J.P. Morgan to Pay $200M for Supervision Errors
reasoning: The Securities and Exchange Commission charged J.P. Morgan Securities LLC (JPMS) and J.P. Morgan Investment Management Inc. (JPMIM) for various violations including misleading disclosures, breach of fiduciary duty, and failures in reporting.
The Financial Industry Regulatory Authority (FINRA) imposed a $3 million fine on J.P. Morgan for inaccuracies in systemwide reporting.
J.P. Morgan will pay over $150 million to settle multiple SEC charges regarding compliance failures.
The SEC announced that J.P. Morgan affiliates will pay $151 million to settle enforcement actions related to various compliance issues.
The Commodity Futures Trading Commission charged J.P. Morgan Securities for failing to supervise its business effectively, resulting in a $200 million penalty.
news: The Securities and Exchange Commission charged J.P. Morgan Securities LLC (JPMS) and J.P. Morgan Investment Management Inc. (JPMIM) for various violations including misleading disclosures, breach of fiduciary duty, and failures in reporting.
The Financial Industry Regulatory Authority (FINRA) imposed a $3 million fine on J.P. Morgan for inaccuracies in systemwide reporting.
J.P. Morgan will pay over $150 million to settle multiple SEC charges regarding compliance failures.
The SEC announced that J.P. Morgan affiliates will pay $151 million to settle enforcement actions related to various compliance issues.
The Commodity Futures Trading Commission charged J.P. Morgan Securities for failing to supervise its business effectively, resulting in a $200 million penalty.
